newsArray.title: 'Ek Taraf Se Mohammad, Ek Taraf Se Krishna': Gill's One-Liner Goes Viral - WATCH
creator: ABP Live Sports
newsArray.description: As the first Test between India and England continues at Headingley, Leeds, a light-hearted moment involving Indian captain Shubman Gill is catching fans‚Äô attention on social media.While India set a target of 371 runs for England, the hosts have made a strong start on Day 5, reaching 220 for loss of two wickets in the second session.With Indian bowlers hunting for more breakthroughs, a viral moment has added some humor to the high-stakes atmosphere.Shubman‚Äôs On-Field Comment ViralA post circulating online claims that Shubman Gill was heard on the stump mic saying, ‚ÄúEk taraf Mohammad, ek taraf Krishna. Dono tabahi machayenge‚Äù ‚Äî which roughly translates to ‚ÄúOne end has Mohammad, the other has Krishna. Both will wreak havoc.‚ÄùWhile the remark is being widely shared and celebrated by fans for its wit, no verified video has surfaced yet confirming it from the official broadcast. Nevertheless, the comment has added a dose of levity to what has otherwise been a tense session for Team India.üö®SHUBMAN GILL ON THE STUMPS MIC:üö®"Ek taraf Mohammad hain, doosre taraf Krishna. Dono tabahi macha dege". pic.twitter.com/KJw4ZseZUH‚Äî DIVYANSH CHAUHAN (@Imchauhan28) June 24, 2025SHUBMAN GILL ON THE STUMPS MIC:"Ek taraf Mohammad hain, doosri taraf Krishna. Dono tabahi macha denge". üò≠ pic.twitter.com/C9RAtnTaH4‚Äî  ü·¥è·¥°·¥ã·¥á è ·¥ç·¥á·¥ç·¥á Ä (@memerbhoiii) June 24, 2025SHUBMAN GILL ON THE STUMPS MIC:"Ek taraf Mohammad hain, doosre taraf Krishna. Dono tabahi macha dege".#ShubmanGill #ENGvIND pic.twitter.com/ahxxjFJjvL‚Äî iamgenz17 (@Gallukumar17) June 24, 2025More to follow...
